itemDescription: British teacher; mother of Anthony Edward Nolan; set up the world's first bone marrow donor register (1942-2002)

wikipedia_page.main: Shirley Nolan or Shirley Oakey (10 February 1942 – 3 December 2001) was a British teacher who set up the Anthony Nolan Register to allow Bone marrow transplants. Her son died and she was diagnosed with Parkinson disease taking her own life in 2001. The charity she founded made transplants possible for 4,000 people.

response: The charity is named after Anthony Nolan (born 1971–died 1979), who did not suffer from leukaemia but from Wiskott–Aldrich syndrome, a rare inherited blood disorder. It was founded by Anthony's mother Shirley Nolan (1942–2001) in 1974 as the Anthony Nolan Register.
*Shirley Nolan (1942–2001), British teacher and charity founder

link_mentions.page: Pontefract and District Girls High School
response: * Shirley Nolan, medical campaigner set up "Anthony Nolan" register
